learning_outcomes.description: Describe the basic principles of quantum mechanics, its connection to other areas of physics, and to real-world problems.
Apply the mathematical principles and methods of quantum theory to solve quantitative problems, and analyse the results.
Demonstrate practical skills for experimental investigation in quantum physics, and interpret and communicate the results.
Interpret and explain technical communications in relation to the basic principles of quantum mechanics.

assessments.due_date: Students will be asked to hand in solutions to one problem/quiz in weeks 2-13. This problem/quiz will be solved under exam conditions in the applied class. Only the best six grades each student achieves will count towards the course mark.
assessments.task_description:
There will be 12 Problem Sets/Quizzes during the semester, which will include the weekly assignment problems. Solutions to selected problems from each Problem Set /Quiz will need to be submitted by students in each applied class. These questions will be solved under exam conditions. They will be marked for correctness and based on the student's ability to show their understanding of the material presented in the relevant section of the course. 

The applied class and assignment problems will be based on the material covered in lectures and in your textbook.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Solutions must be handed in during the applied class.
